summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 among legal counsel regarding a defense motion and subpoena in the Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case. It involves coordination between defense attorneys and prosecutors about sharing a motion containing confidential information subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney communicating about providing a copy of a defense motion to the government, deferring to government's protective order.

persons.name: Brian Burns
persons.context: Attorney at Smith Villazor LLP requesting a copy of the defense motion seeking issuance of a subpoena.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP sending a signed subpoena to counsel.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense counsel copied on email regarding subpoena.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Counsel listed as recipient of subpoena email.

persons.name: Patrick Smit
persons.context: Attorney copied on email regarding subpoena.

connections.description: Pagliuca responds to Burns' request for a defense motion, coordinating under government protective order.
Everdell sends a signed subpoena to Sternheim as counsel.
Both are attorneys copied on email chain regarding legal motions and subpoenas.

events.title: Defense Motion Filed
events.description: Defense files motion seeking issuance of a subpoena, referenced in attached documents.

events.title: Subpoena Sent
events.description: Christian Everdell sends signed subpoena to counsel including Bobbi Sternheim.

events.title: Request for Defense Motion
events.description: Brian Burns requests copy of defense motion from defense counsel.

events.title: Unredacted Motion Provided
events.description: Unredacted defense motion is provided to Brian Burns in light of email coordination.

locations: 250 West 55th Street, 30th Floor, New York, New York 10019
keyFacts: The document shows ongoing legal proceedings in late 2021 related to the Epstein/Maxwell case, specifically regarding a defense motion and subpoena.
A protective order from the government designates all productions as confidential, controlling the sharing of the defense motion.
The defense motion contains information designated as confidential and is subject to government approval for distribution.
Multiple law firms are involved: Cohen & Gresser LLP, Smith Villazor LLP, and others, indicating a coordinated legal effort.
